Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery vessel, interior covered with a dark-brown resinous substance, exterior covered with a light-brown slip and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now worn in places, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.188)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36444) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36444)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 302 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
